meta.product_metis.title: Metis One — Tender & proposal automation
meta.product_metis.description: Automate tenders, smetas and commercial proposals with templates, material prices and overheads in one system.
product.metis.hero.title: Metis One Tender — proposals, smetas and budgets in one system
product.metis.hero.subtitle: For construction companies, manufacturers, suppliers and anyone who regularly prepares commercial offers.
product.metis.segments.title: Tailored to your type of business
product.metis.segments.intro: Metis One is flexible enough to support construction tenders, manufacturing cost calculations and supplier price logic.
product.metis.segments.construction.text: Use templates for BOQ positions, auto-fill labor and materials and keep all smetas structured.
product.metis.segments.manufacturers.tex: Connect materials, operations and markups in one place and quickly recalculate costs per order.
product.metis.segments.suppliers.title: Suppliers / distributors
product.metis.segments.suppliers.text: Keep your catalogue, discounts and customer types consistent — generate offers in minutes.

product.metis.features.materials.title: Material & price database
product.metis.features.materials.text: Centralized materials and price lists, with integrations like Lemana Pro to keep your base up to date.
product.metis.features.techcards.title: Technical cards & templates
product.metis.features.techcards.text: Create operation templates once and reuse them in any project, smeta or quote.
product.metis.features.overheads.title: Overheads, profit & risk
product.metis.features.overheads.text: Apply consistent overhead and profit logic instead of redoing formulas in every Excel file.
product.metis.features.reports.title: Clear reports & exports
product.metis.features.reports.text: Export to Excel/PDF in the format your clients expect, with full transparency of positions and markups.

product.metis.workflow.step3.text: We configure your materials, technical cards and pricing logic inside Metis One.

product.metis.workflow.step5.text: Together we prepare your first proposal or smeta inside Metis One.
product.metis.workflow.step6.title: Support & optimization
product.metis.workflow.step6.text: We fine-tune templates and reports based on real usage.
product.metis.workflow.highlight.title: 7 days from contract to working system
product.metis.workflow.highlight.text: Adaptation is included in every tariff. We don’t charge for a "dead" setup — only for a system your team actually uses.

meta.userexp.title: Metis One — User experiences & use cases
meta.userexp.description: Real use cases of Metis One in construction, manufacturing and supplier businesses — before/after stories and metrics.
userexp.hero.title: How companies actually use Metis One
userexp.hero.subtitle: Real stories from teams that moved from chaotic Excel files to a structured tender & budgeting system.
userexp.before.title: Before Metis One
userexp.after.title: After Metis One
userexp.case1.title: From 2–3 days per tender to a few hours
userexp.case1.before1: BOQs in Excel with different formats for each project.
userexp.case1.before2: 2–3 days to prepare a full tender, copy-pasting from old files.
userexp.case1.before3: No unified templates for typical positions and operations.
userexp.case1.after1: Common templates for typical positions and operations.
userexp.case1.after2: Tenders prepared in a few hours instead of days.
userexp.case1.after3: Easier handover between engineers thanks to one structure.
userexp.case1.metric1.label: Time per tender
userexp.case1.metric2.label: Number of offers / month
userexp.case1.quote: “Before Metis One we had at least three different versions of ‘final.xls’. Now we have one system and we can see what each engineer is doing.”
userexp.case2.title: From manual recalculation to consistent cost logic
userexp.case2.before1: Each manager used own Excel file for calculations.
userexp.case2.before2: Difficult to explain why one client had different price than another.
userexp.case2.after1: Unified templates for operations and markups.
userexp.case2.after2: Clear explanation of price structure for any client.
userexp.case2.metric1.label: Price consistency
userexp.case2.quote: “Now when a client asks ‘how did you get this price?’ we have a clear structure and can show the logic, not just a number.”
userexp.case3.title: One catalogue, many client types
userexp.case3.before1: Different Excel lists for dealers, retailers and project clients.
userexp.case3.after1: One catalogue with different markups for each client type.
userexp.case3.quote: “We no longer argue which Excel is the latest. There is one base and different conditions per client type.”
